intro: Colensoa, commonly known as the New Zealand flax, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Asphodelaceae and is characterized by its tall, erect stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers in dense clusters at the top of the stems. Colensoa is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has historical significance in Māori culture. It prefers well-drained soils and full sun, making it suitable for coastal and temperate gardens.
